sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Welcome to Unit 64 of our English learning journey. In this unit, we'll explore the nuanced uses of 'to,' 'for,' and 'so that' in different contexts.

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: Understanding the distinctions between these prepositions is essential for effective communication. Let's delve into the key concepts.

sections.title: To for
points: Explore the use of 'to' for indicating direction or purpose.
He studies hard to succeed in exams

sections.title: 'For' for
points: Examine the versatile use of 'for' to express purpose, recipient, or duration.
I've been learning English for five years

sections.title: 'So That' for
sections.content: 'So That' for Expressing Purpose or Result
points: Understand how 'so that' is used to express purpose or the intended result of an action.
He works hard so that he can provide for his family
She speaks slowly so that everyone can understand

sections.title: Examples
sections.content: Let's examine examples to illustrate the application of 'to ,' 'for ' and 'so that ':

examples.Positive: I'm going to the library to borrow a book
examples.Negative: She baked a cake for her friend's birthday
examples.Interrogative: He saved money so that he could travel around the world

sections.title: Usage and Context
sections.content: Understand the appropriate contexts for using 'to,' 'for,' and 'so that' and how they contribute to the meaning of a sentence.

sections.title: Recap and Summary:
sections.content: In summary, understanding the varied uses of 'to' 'for,' and 'so that' is crucial for constructing clear and purposeful sentences.

sections.title: Additional Resources:
sections.content: For additional practice and reinforcement, consider exploring examples in language learning books and online exercises.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.content: Thank you for joining today's lesson on 'to , for  and so that .' Practice using these prepositions confidently in various situations, and feel free to reach out if you have any questions. Happy learning!
